review_en: In commemoration of the 200th anniversary of the foundation of the Catholic Church in Korea, where visitors can see the remains of adults, construction began in 1984 and completed in three years. Saenamteo is named because it has many silver grass and trees. It was also called Sanamgi because it was translated into Chinese characters. It has been used as a military base since the early Joseon Dynasty, and has also been used as a place for execution of felons. It is also the place for the execution of the breeding god and General Nami. Starting with the New Persecution in 1801, many Catholics were executed here when there was oppression against Catholics such as Gihaehae, Byeongokhae, and Byeongin Parkhae. Among them, Kim Dae-gun (Andrea), the first priest of the Joseon people, was the first to visit Korea.
